wakeword module¶

class wakeword.WakeWordListener(model_path, ss_model_path, vad_model, silence_threshold=0.5, silence_duration=2.0, rate=16000, chunk_size=800, num_samples=512)[source]¶

Bases: object

Class for detecting a wake word using a pre-trained model, recording audio upon detection, and saving the audio to a file.

model_path¶

Path to the wake word detection model.

Type:

str

silence_threshold¶

Confidence threshold below which audio is considered silence. Default is 0.5.

Type:

float

silence_duration¶

Duration in seconds of continuous silence required to stop recording. Default is 2.0.

Type:

float

rate¶

Sampling rate for the audio stream. Default is 16000.

Type:

int

chunk_size¶

Size of audio chunks to read from the stream. Default is 800.

Type:

int

num_samples¶

Number of samples for buffering audio chunks. Default is 512.

Type:

int

continue_recording = False¶
int2float(sound)[source]¶

Converts an integer audio signal to a floating-point representation.

Parameters:

sound (np.ndarray) – The input audio signal as a NumPy array of integer values.

Returns:

A normalized floating-point representation of the audio signal, with dtype float32.

Return type:

np.ndarray

Listen for the wake word

Returns:

None

load_wakeword_model(model_paths)[source]¶

Loads the wake word detection model.

Parameters:

model_path (str) – Path to the wake word detection model.

Returns:

The loaded wake word detection model.

Return type:

Model

Raises:

FileNotFoundError – If the specified model path does not exist.

record_audio()[source]¶

Records audio until the specified duration of silence is detected

Returns:

A list of recorded audio frames.

Return type:

list

save_to_wav(filename)[source]¶

Saves recorded audio frames to a WAV file.

Parameters:

filename (str) – The name of the output WAV file.

Returns:

None

stop_recording()[source]¶

Stops the recording process when silence condition is met.

Returns:

None

wakeword.listen_for_command(model_path, shutdown_model_path, vad_model, filename)[source]¶

Starts the wake word detection and recording process, and saves the output to a WAV file.

Parameters:

filename (str) – Name of the file to save the recorded audio.
